title: How many viewers will tune in to watch Sunday Night Football on 10 December 2017?
possible_answers: More than 15 million but less than 15.5 million
preds:
http://www.sportsmediawatch.com/nfl-tv-ratings-viewership-nbc-cbs-fox-espn-nfln-regular-season-playoffs/ Weeks 8-10 showed a significant decline over 2016, but Weeks 11-13 have been up again. Rolling the dice, based on @danbell7819! 
Also:-
"The league saved one of the best matchups in Week 14 of the 2017 NFL for last. Tonight’s Sunday Night Football contest is another primetime AFC North affair, this time featuring the division leading Pittsburgh Steelers against the second-place Baltimore Ravens. It’s a high-stakes showdown that you won’t want to miss, especially given the history between these organizations."
https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexkay/2017/12/10/pittsburgh-steelers-vs-baltimore-ravens-sunday-night-football-week-14-odds-and-expert-picks/#f4cc57a27673
Going all in on over 16M. Brier score be damned!
Baltimore @ Pittsburg.  Pittsburg should draw a crowd. Baltimore will not.

Since there seems to be some confusion, the SNF is between the Baltimore Ravens (7-5) and Pittsburgh Steelers (10-2). Pittsburgh is fighting to stay #1 in the AFC, and Baltimore is fighting to knock Pittsburgh out of first in the AFC North as well as improve its own playoff standing.
Cold snap across much of east coast will keep people indoors but the game itself, Pats vs Dolphins, has few playoff implications.
Even though it is a Sunday night game and maybe the fourth game of the week, it will be an  important outcome with regards to Playoffs so more people will watch the game
Patriots are trying to be the new America's Team....Dolphins don't have many fans but they are loyal.

Somewhere out there are eleven or twelve people still boycotting NFL football until the teams or the league or somebody fires everyone Mr. Tangerine Man has decreed should be fired.  They will not fill the resulting idle hours with edifying reading.
tbe anger over the Goodsell contract eztension may renew interest in the boycott.
This is a big rivalry with playoff implications. The trend over the past several weeks has been above 16M.
